summary: This bill, S. 2669, mandates the Secretary of Defense to develop and implement a strategy to bolster multilateral deterrence within the Indo-Pacific region. The strategy focuses on enhancing coordination with allies like Japan, South Korea, the Philippines, and Australia. It involves improving access agreements, command structures, intelligence sharing, and military exercises. The Secretary must submit the strategy to Congress, outlining necessary funding, and provide an interim report. The bill also defines the Indo-Pacific region.
